questions.question_text: Which administrative management services can be configured to access a management interface?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I just checked. On the GUI only these 4 items can be selected in the "Administrative Management Services" section:
HTTP, HTTPS, Telnet and SSH

comments.content: P.S API uses HTTP/HTTPS as well

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Methods of access
The four methods used to access the Palo Alto Networks Next-Generation Firewalls are:

● Web interface
● CLI
● Panorama
● XML API

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.Only SSH and HTTPS are recommended in Best Practice.
telnet ?? really ??

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/firewall-administration/management-interfaces

answer is A

comments.content:
The question is talking about "administrative management services" about the management interface not management interfaces.
Tested in a lab: From PanOS 11.0 firewall go to Device -> Setup -> Interfaces -> Management -> Administrative Management -> Services - you will see these options : HTTP, HTTPS, TELNET, SSH.
That is why the answer is C not A.

discussion.content: C is correct

Selected Answer: C
The administrative management services are http,https,telnet and ssh

Selected Answer: C
Definitely C - I'm looking at the management interface settings here on my palo alto - ssh/telnet/http/https/
A or C?

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/firewall-administration/management-interfaces

comments.content: The link you've provided is fine - but it shows the answer = C

choices.C: Palo Alto Networks Known Malicious IP Addresses
choices.A: Palo Alto Networks C&G IP Addresses
choices.D: Palo Alto Networks Bulletproof IP Addresses
choices.B: Palo Alto Networks High Risk IP Addresses

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
According to Palo Alto, the correct answer is D

https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA10g000000PM0pCAG

Selected Answer: D
Palo Alto Networks Bulletproof IP Addresses—Contains IP addresses provided by bulletproof hosting providers. Because bulletproof hosting providers place few, if any, restrictions on content, attackers frequently use these services to host and distribute malicious, illegal, and unethical material.

Selected Answer: D
D, is correct

questions.question_text: Which feature would be useful for preventing traffic from hosting providers that place few restrictions on content whose services are frequently used by attackers to distribute illegal or unethical material?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
block traffic TO IP addresses.
To being the keyword on the question.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
it's saying "to" IP address and not "from"

questions.question_text: Which security policy match condition would an administrator use to block traffic to IP addresses on the Palo Alto Networks Bulletproof IP Addresses list?
Which three filter columns are available when setting up an Application Filter? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Answers are correct B,C,E 

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-web-interface-help/objects/objects-application-filters

Selected Answer: B
Weaponization and Delivery: Attackers will then determine which methods to use in order to deliver malicious payloads. Some of the methods they might utilize are automated tools, such as exploit kits, spear phishing attacks with malicious links, or attachments and malvertizing.

 Gain full visibility into all traffic, including SSL, and block high-risk applications. Extend those protections to remote and mobile devices.
 Protect against perimeter breaches by blocking malicious or risky websites through URL filtering.
 Block known exploits, malware and inbound command-and-control communications using multiple threat prevention disciplines, including IPS, anti-malware, anti-CnC, DNS monitoring and sinkholing, and file and content blocking.
 Detect unknown malware and automatically deliver protections globally to thwart new attacks.
 Provide ongoing education to users on spear phishing links, unknown emails, risky websites, etc.

The answer is B, not A. In reconnaissance, you educate users what inside info they shouldn't post: "sensitive documents, customer lists, event attendees, job roles and responsibilities (i.e., using specific security tools within an organization), etc."
 Delivery: "Provide ongoing education to users on spear phishing links, unknown emails, risky websites, etc."

Selected Answer: B
B:

Delivery is when the adversary interacts with the potential victims.

Selected Answer: B
It's Delivery

Selected Answer: B
Weaponization and Delivery

questions.question_text: Which stage of the cyber attack lifecycle makes it important to provide ongoing education to users on spear phishing links, unknown emails, and risky websites?
